alert.note: Alert for Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 2:27PM CDT until June 04 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in Arkansas, Crawford and Sebastian. In Oklahoma, Le Flore and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 227 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Barling... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... Arkoma... Hackett... Bonanza... Moffett... Fort Smith Regional Airport... Jenny Lind... Figure Five... Excelsior... Mill Creek... Dora... Braden... Cottonwood... Rye Hill... Shibley... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
